intro: Pagamea, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Pagamea thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
